Question: Though interest in this person's ideas survived, they were generally taken unquestioningly.
Hints: This person "says that 'on the subject of reasoning' he 'had nothing else on an earlier date to speak of'".
Russell also refers to this person's ethics as "repulsive", and calls his logic "as definitely antiquated as Ptolemaic astronomy".
This person's conception of the city is organic, and he is considered one of the first to conceive of the city in this manner.
